title: Liam Payne channels Superman as he poses up a storm at the KISS Haunted House Party
text:
Liam Payne channelled his inner Superman as he posed on the red carpet of the KISS Haunted House Party at the SSE Arena in Wembley on Friday night.

The Bedroom Floor hitmaker, 26, put on a dapper display in a Clark Kent/Superman inspired look as he joined a host of famous faces at the spooky event in London.

Liam's appearance comes after he heaped praise on his 'absolutely awesome' ex-girlfriend Cheryl during an appearance on The Jonathan Ross Show, which will air on Friday night.

Heroic look: Liam Payne channelled his inner Superman as he posed on the red carpet of the KISS Haunted House Party at the SSE Arena in Wembley on Friday night

Posing up a storm on the red carpet, the One Direction star showcased his costume which consisted of a black suit and a white shirt that he wore open to reveal the iconic Superman 'S' underneath.

Putting on an animated display at the event, Liam held onto his shirt to pretend that he was ripping it off to reveal his Superman suit.

The singer also wore glasses to emulate the Man Of Steel's everyday persona, and his outfit was complete with a pair of black braces.

At the event, Liam opened up about his two-year-old son Bear and his new Christmas song.

Former flame: Liam's appearance comes after he heaped praise on his 'absolutely awesome' ex-girlfriend Cheryl during an appearance on The Jonathan Ross Show, which will air on Friday

Speaking of his boy, whom he shares with Cheryl, he said: 'He’s been great, he’s been really good, just chill as usual.'

While the star discussed why he decided to bring out a festive single.

He explained: 'I think we’ve sang one Christmas song when I was in the band but this was like an original song. We went for something a little bit different based on the Christmas that I had once a while ago and yeah, it seemed to make sense.'

When asked if he was nervous to release a Christmas son, he responded: 'With this one, I was quite a bit, yeah.

Posing up a storm: The One Direction star showcased his costume which consisted of a black suit and a white shirt that he wore open to reveal the iconic Superman 'S' underneath

Is it a bird? Is it a plane? Liam Payne put on a dapper display in a Clark Kent/Superman inspired look

'Because you don’t really know what to expect from a Christmas song because it’s not something I’ve ever done before, it’s new ground for me. Christmas songs are like legendary, they stay around and do their thing and there hasn’t been a new one for a while, so I tried to do something a bit different.'

Liam later rocked the stage as he performed for the crowds in his not-so-scary Clarke Kent ensemble.

The One Direction star put on animated display as he worked the stage and sung his biggest hits.

His performance comes following his comments about ex Cheryl, in which he said the singer, 36, is 'a fantastic mum' to their son Bear, two, as he offered an insight into how the former couple share parenting duties.

Smart: Putting on an animated display at the event, Liam held onto his shirt to pretend that he was ripping it off to reveal his Superman suit

Smirk: Liam couldn't help but smile as he posed for photos when he arrived on the red carpet

In the wide ranging interview with chat show host Ross, 58, the musician also said he 'missed' being in One Direction and revealed Bear had been through a 'real rap phase'.

Speaking of Cheryl, the star said the former Girls Aloud singer was supportive of his hectic career meaning that he often didn't have time for his son.

'She is a fantastic mum, I can't complain, she's absolutely awesome,' he said.

Wow: The One Direction hunk smouldered into the camera at the event

Animated: Liam seemed to be having a great time, as he posed up a storm on the red carpet to show off his costume

Model behaviour: Liam posed and pouted at the Halloween event

'She doesn't get on to me when I'm out working, doing different things, she understands, we do the very same job so it's not that different for us but yeah, she's awesome.'

The singer, who recently revealed that because of his touring schedule he goes weeks without seeing Bear, revealed his son's love of rap music.

'He comes over to my house every so often and we just hang out. He is literally the most easy going child,' he said.

'I think you put pressure on yourself as a dad sometimes, especially it's hard to connect with a two-year-old, they will laugh at anything.

'He had a real rap phase where he was buzzing off listening to [rap]... When we put rap music on, he'd be up [dancing],' he added.

Chatty man: Liam spoke to a number of journalists after he finished posing for photos

Sing it: Elsewhere, Liam rocked the stage as he donned his not-so-scary Clarke Kent ensemble

Passion: The singer reached out to the crowd and closed his eyes as he belted out his tracks

Sing it: The Bedroom Floor singer put on animated display as he worked the stage and sung his biggest hits

Liam's praise of Cheryl comes after he revealed in a recent interview that the pair 'rubbed off on each other in a bad way' during their relationship.

Speaking on Jessie Ware's Table Manners podcast about the strain on their romance, the star said: 'I think we kind of rubbed off on each other a little bit in that way. In a bad way, actually.

'All of that stuff puts so much pressure on a relationship.'

The former One Direction star also said she had become anxious about going out with him in public, due to the constant attention the pair received.

Liam also hinted he was 'frightened' of Cheryl during their romance and said: 'She's strict. She's surprised me sometimes.'

When asked if he was frightened of her, he said: 'Let's say I've been on the receiving end of that quite a lot.'

Dapper: The One Direction hunk cut a dapper figure in his smart ensemble

Stage presence: The Strip That Down crooner was in his element on the KISS stage
description: The Bedroom Floor hitmaker, 26, put on a dapper display in a Clark Kent/Superman inspired at the KISS Haunted House Party at the SSE Arena in Wembley on Friday night.
